title: API suggestion: ".gpu()" instead of ".cuda()"
body_html:
Hi, I was thinking, that renaming .cuda() to .gpu() would before the API stabilizes in the later beta. I I am not sure if OpenCL support is planned at all, but I thought that gpu would be more general than cuda -- and if OpenCL support is going to be added one day, one wouldn't have to rewrite already existing PyTorch implementations but just change an environment variable, e.g., $PYTORCH_GPU=CUDA or $PYTORCH_GPU=OPENCL or sth. along those lines.

Let me know if there's interest in that, I'd more than happy to submit a PR at some point. Also, in this context, maybe having a documentation that is decoupled from the master branches (e.g., adding the "pytorch/tutorlials" to the website) may be a good idea so that users of the current stable release don't get confused when API changes get introduced.

body:
Hi, I was thinking, that renaming `.cuda()` to `.gpu()` would before the API stabilizes in the later beta. I I am not sure if OpenCL support is planned at all, but I thought that `gpu` would be more general than `cuda` -- and if OpenCL support is going to be added one day, one wouldn't have to rewrite already existing PyTorch implementations but just change an environment variable, e.g., `$PYTORCH_GPU=CUDA` or` $PYTORCH_GPU=OPENCL` or sth. along those lines. 

Let me know if there's interest in that, I'd more than happy to submit a PR at some point. Also, in this context, maybe having a documentation that is decoupled from the master branches (e.g., adding the  "pytorch/tutorlials" to the website) may be a good idea so that users of the current stable release don't get confused when API changes get introduced.
